head.title: Miami Herald Names Editor From Colorado

hedline.hl1: Miami Herald Names Editor From Colorado

block.p: LEAD: Janet Chusmir, president and publisher of The Daily Camera in Boulder, Colo., will become executive editor of The Miami Herald in May, Richard G. Capen, the publisher of The Herald, said today.
LEAD: Janet Chusmir, president and publisher of The Daily Camera in Boulder, Colo., will become executive editor of The Miami Herald in May, Richard G. Capen, the publisher of The Herald, said today.
Janet Chusmir, president and publisher of The Daily Camera in Boulder, Colo., will become executive editor of The Miami Herald in May, Richard G. Capen, the publisher of The Herald, said today.
Mrs. Chusmir, 57 years old, will replace Heath Meriwether, 43, who has held the post since July 1983.

Replacing Mrs. Chusmir as publisher in Boulder will be John L. Dotson Jr., director of night operations for Philadelphia Newspapers Inc., which publishes The Philadelphia Inquirer and The Philadelphia Daily News.
All the newspapers involved are owned by Knight-Ridder Inc.
Larry Jinks, Knight-Ridder's senior vice president for news and operations, said Mr. Meriwether will take on a significant assignment in another part of the country when he leaves Miami.

Mrs. Chusmir was a member of the staff of The Miami Herald from 1968 to 1982. In that period she was a reporter, columnist, features editor, editor of the Living Today section and assignment managing editor for features.
Mr. Dotson, 50, began his career as a reporter for The Newark Evening News. He joined Philadelphia Newspapers Inc. in 1983.
Mr. Meriwether joined The Herald in 1970 as a general assignment reporter.
